content:
Sure, here's a calculation for the market sizing exercise in terms of USD:

1. Estimated market size: To calculate the market size, we first need to determine the target market segment. In this case, the target market segment is brand YouTube channels with more than 100,000 subscribers.

SOM (Serviceable Obtainable Market) = SAM x average number of subscribers per brand YouTube channel = 444,000 x 41,900 = 18.6 billion
2. Estimated revenue per subscriber: There is no specific data available on this, so we made an assumption of $0.10 per subscriber per month based on industry knowledge and research.
3. Estimated annual revenue for YouTube channel management tool providers:

Annual Revenue = SOM x Estimated revenue per subscriber per month x 12 months = 18.6 billion x $0.10 x 12 = $22.32 billion per year

Please note that these are assumptions based on industry knowledge and research, and may not be entirely accurate. Additionally, this market sizing exercise does not take into account other factors such as pricing models for YouTube channel management tools or revenue from other sources.
